l2d.title: L2D Agency
l2d.projectDescription: Agency Website featuring a portfolio of work.

mainImage.caption: The L2D Logo inside a custom ThreeJS script generated from a live video feed.

content.article: The L2D website reflects a portfolio of work in a single page. Everything on the page is custom and features Greensock animations. Everything from the icon to the content on-scroll is animated in. The inline forms are validated through native javascript and styled through SCSS. Each project is loaded from custom structured data.

images.caption: The contact information is displayed along side the contact form.
The project grid contains advanced SCSS styles to display a dropshadow on hover.
The ThreeJS script displays translated video in a 3d pattern with alternative styles.
The forms are styled with parallaxed background images. The forms are validated through native Javascript.
The L2D website is responsive and functions across a range of devices.
If no one is at the office the ThreeJS script remains fairly static.
The ThreeJS script on mobile devices.
The menu opens in a dramatic animation over client logos while elements parralax in the background.
The top of the page can be expanded into a dashboard which also interaction with the L2D employees as they work. Catch the at the right time, they might wave hello!
The Client logos load as the user scrolls towards the content. Once loaded the logos are animated in.
Projects are displayed in a flexible grid with corresponding icons and animations.

sos.title: Safe Online Surfing
sos.projectDescription: SOS features games butilt with HTML5 and Javascript

mainImage.caption: A character makes surfs their way around several obstacles.

content.article: This website is built with sessionStorage to keep user data. User data is applied via a gamestate to keep track of student's interaction. This website largely leverages CSS transitions rather than javascript animation. SOS functions well even on deprecated browser and is built to be IE9 Strict! The content's data structure allows for easy language translation. An entire side project was built leveraging node.js to convert the site's data to spreadsheets and then back to JSON.

images.caption: The Home landing page displays all of the critical information in a highly visible manner. Students can choose which grade level they'd like to play.

Students must collect all of the hidden coins. Once a coin is revealed the student must answer a challenge question. If the submitted answer is correct a coin is collected. The Health Bar displays the game status.
Line up the board walk to create a path across to the other beach.
Each grade has it's own character and color scheme. In addition the island is themed for the character.
Students must answer questions during the games in order to succesfully finish.
Questions can be formatted in several ways but all use the same general structure and class names.
Each island contains several themed challenges involving.
In Computer Health students must keep their computer healthy by responding to a series of questions.
A surfing character succesfully dodges an obstacle after a correct answer.
A Congratulation screen after succesfully completing a challenge.
The Island can be configured with dots placed at any point on the screen. The dots and numbers are mapped to various games.
A challenge to unlock all the spaces within a game.
The modal present information about the contest in order to keep educators informed.
Users are presented a set of instructions for completing each seperate contest.
The student must match the word with the definition.
The difficulty of the contest depends on the grade level.
A succesfull completion of the surfing game before the final screen.

rtc.title: Ringgold Telecommunications Company
rtc.projectDescription: Telecommunications Provider Website built with Foundation and Craft.

content.article: RTC needed a proven front-end reliable enough for customers to gain access to essential services. Special attention was payed to accesibility and performance tests. RTC is sleek and stylish while serving the public.

images.caption: The site uses parallax to emphasize graphics in a two-column responsive layout.
RTC features several animations including a three JS wave along with an SVG throttle animation.
Desktop layout featuring a header, SVG icons and a list. The Youtube video is animated in place.
Responsive view of the header content.
The Home page features a standard Header and text along with a very visible button and tagline.
The desktop home page featuring ThreeJS animations.
RTC features completely custom and styled forms. The forms use native Javascript along with server-side validation.
A slider feaaturing unique content in a responsive format.
A CSS animated chart displaying compared internet speeds.
An interior page featuring a video using the Youtube Javascript API.
The footer is highly flexible and utilizes list styling.
The Interior page headers include movies that autoplay on mobile and desktop.
RTC users can easily connect by using the styled forms along with native validation.
All of the interior content is created within a CMS and is template driven.

crg.title: Chattanooga Roller Girls
crg.projectDescription: A Wordpress site built from the Foundation Sites Framework

mainImage.caption: The mascott of the CRG skates forward while the website loads.

content.article: This custom-built Wordpress Theme for the Chattanooga WFTDA Roller Derby team features several custom plugins. Advanced User Roles, Custom Categories, Custom Types, Google Analytics... the works! This theme was developed from the groundup to be versatile. Chattanooga Roller Girls features smooth page transitions for a seemless experience through javascript.

images.caption: Team mascott skates by while the data loads.
Individual Skater pages are presented in slider which tracks the user's history using the history API.
the Next Home Bouts are displayed front and center even on odd sized devices.
An indiviual's skater pages takes up more of the frame on a mobile device.
The Schedule page is a similar layout to the homepage so that users are presented information in a manner that feels familiar.
CRG connects live to the Instagram Feed so that images are always current.
Coaches and Staff are also in a responsive format.
Skater's are presented in pairs on mobile.
The Logo is made using SVG
When switching between interior views the page smoothly transitions and interupts the viewer with a loading screen.
Sponsors are layed out in a responsive grid fixed to a ratio.
This theme depends on custom data and logic before presenting a readable schedule.
The Homepage view on desktop for CRG.
The page content is still readable even on tiny devices!
Any device can fetch the most recent photos the the Instagram API.
Homepage Desktop view with banner.
Homepage Mobile view with banner.
On mobile devices the hamburger menu expands to reveal an offscreen menu.

buntin.title: Buntin Media Group
buntin.projectDescription: Unique creative advertising agency website with Vue.js

mainImage.caption: The Buntin Logo show while the experience loads.

images.caption: The parallaxing content enters on the screen while the user scrolls.
The Adhope page showing headline and logo on Desktop.
A grid of portfolio images are presented on a client page.
Each agency card fits within all mobile devices.
A poster series for multiple years presented in a responsive slider with progressive loading.
Main section content while hovered reveals a CTA while moving in a 3d space.
The Buntin Logo is presented on website load.
An infomation box expanded from the info button on a agency history page.
The Loading screen for the entire experience.
Informational cards for each employee staggers in from top to bottom as the page loads.
The Home page on desktop plays a video in the background.
The Home page on mobile is very flexible and can respond to any size.
The Home page presents a powerful video and entices the user to scroll down with a clickable button.
The menu opens to reveal an entire screen and a map via the Google Maps API.
The footer displays a reusable card component, used also on the home page just below a slider of images.
A grid of logos which displays SVGs in a waterfall animation.
The contact page is the last station in the main view.
Section Headers along with accompanying paragraph text with navigation bar below.
The interior view showing a header image and title along with left and right arrows to advance between section content.
floating informatinal boxes along with logos tell a story.
A view of the history page on desktop.
The user can scroll through entire sections presented as cards.
Each section is presented on a card delivered along a scrollable path.

drm.title: Deer Run Media
drm.projectDescription: Craft template featuring a unique boutique video agency content.

mainImage.caption: Deer Run Media Logo
mainImage.alt: The Logo is presented to users on first load in a dramatic film-type presentation.

content.article: Deer Run Media is a local Visual Art and Video Production Company. This project shows off their unique work while minimizing the UI. All the content is presented simply to the user. The project makes extensive use of the HTML5 video API and features an entirely from scratch HTML5 video player.

images.caption: The form uses a javascript API to POST forms.
Projects are presented in similar ways on desktop and mobile.
The Contact Page on desktop.
The contact page on a mobile device.
The project page features a slider of images or video supporting the project.
The DRM Logo on mobile.
images are presented on a mobile device.
example project page on a mobile device.
The Home Page on desktop displays video segments on rollover.
Basic content presented on an about page.
Case Studies are presented in a grid format on desktop.
Mobile Home Page with inline video.
